verses.verse: Thinkest <S%H2803><s%> thou this <S%H2063><s%> to be right, <S%H4941><s%> that thou saidst, <S%H559><s%> My righteousness <S%H6664><s%> is more than God's? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H410><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> thou saidst, <S%H559><s%> What <S%H4100><s%> advantage <S%H5532><s%> will it be unto thee? and, What <S%H4100><s%> profit <S%H3276><s%> shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2403><s%>
I <S%H589><s%> will answer <S%H7725><s%> <S%H4405><s%> thee, and thy companions <S%H7453><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> thee.
Look <S%H5027><s%> unto the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> and see; <S%H7200><s%> and behold <S%H7789><s%> the clouds <S%H7834><s%> which are higher <S%H1361><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> thou.

If <S%H518><s%> thou sinnest, <S%H2398><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> doest <S%H6466><s%> thou against him? or if thy transgressions <S%H6588><s%> be multiplied, <S%H7231><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> doest <S%H6213><s%> thou unto him?

If <S%H518><s%> thou be righteous, <S%H6663><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> givest <S%H5414><s%> thou him? or <S%H176><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> receiveth <S%H3947><s%> he of thine hand? <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3027><s%>
Thy wickedness <S%H7562><s%> may hurt a man <S%H376><s%> as thou <S%H3644><s%> art; and thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%> may profit the son <S%H1121><s%> of man. <S%H120><s%>

By reason of the multitude <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7230><s%> of oppressions <S%H6217><s%> they make the oppressed to cry: <S%H2199><s%> they cry out <S%H7768><s%> by reason of the arm <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2220><s%> of the mighty. <S%H7227><s%>
But none <S%H3808><s%> saith, <S%H559><s%> Where <S%H346><s%> is God <S%H433><s%> my maker, <S%H6213><s%> who giveth <S%H5414><s%> songs <S%H2158><s%> in the night; <S%H3915><s%>

Who teacheth <S%H502><s%> us more than the beasts <S%H4480><s%> <S%H929><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> and maketh us wiser <S%H2449><s%> than the fowls <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5775><s%> of heaven? <S%H8064><s%>
There <S%H8033><s%> they cry, <S%H6817><s%> but none <S%H3808><s%> giveth answer, <S%H6030><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of the pride <S%H1347><s%> of evil men. <S%H7451><s%>
Surely <S%H389><s%> God <S%H410><s%> will not <S%H3808><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> vanity, <S%H7723><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> will the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> regard <S%H7789><s%> it.

Although <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> thou sayest <S%H559><s%> thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> see <S%H7789><s%> him, yet judgment <S%H1779><s%> is before <S%H6440><s%> him; therefore trust <S%H2342><s%> thou in him.

But now, <S%H6258><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> it is not <S%H369><s%> so, he hath visited <S%H6485><s%> in his anger; <S%H639><s%> yet he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> it not <S%H3808><s%> in great <S%H3966><s%> extremity: <S%H6580><s%>
Therefore doth Job <S%H347><s%> open <S%H6475><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> in vain; <S%H1892><s%> he multiplieth <S%H3527><s%> words <S%H4405><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
